definitions: To make a proof of; to test the truth or validity of something.
To make a proof impression of (a page, a picture, etc.).
To make resistant to something, such as water, fire, or rot.
To activate yeast by letting it stand in a warm liquid.
To allow dough to rise due to yeast activation.
examples: The printer will proof the image before mass production.
We need to proof the deck against water damage.
Proof the yeast in warm water.
Let the dough proof for an hour.
